New Records: Spencer Strider achieved his major league-leading 17th win.
Austin Riley hit his 35th home run of the season.
Matt Olson tied Andruw Jones' single-season Braves record with his 51st homer.
The Braves clinched their sixth straight NL East title.
The Braves achieved their 26th division title, a record in MLB.
Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first 30/60 player in baseball history.
Key Match Events: Spencer Strider allowed one run and four hits in seven innings, striking out nine.
Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning.
Kirby Yates struck out Brandon Marsh to end the game.
Kevin Pillar added an RBI double in the fourth inning.
Cristopher Sánchez struck out a career-best 10 in 7 1/3 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker said, 'We’ve checked one box.'
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Rhys Hoskins' potential return in the postseason.
Braves players expressed extra satisfaction in clinching the title at Citizens Bank Park, where they were eliminated last year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves are on pace to finish with 106 wins, which would tie the 1998 Braves for the most wins in the franchise’s nearly 150-year history.
The Braves lead the MLB in wins.
The Braves celebrated with sparkling wine and beer in the visitors' clubhouse.
